W1405-d-02-12-05-AKMD.Narrative: 30. "O" - BLOCK REGISTRY TERRITORY.  HIGHWAY USER FAILED TO CONTROL VEHICLE FAILING TO STOP BEFORE VEHICLE WENT THROUGH GATE AND STRUCK TRAIN.  FOLLOWING THE INCIDENT, OFFICER OF THE ARKANSAS DEPT OFTRANSPORTATION PERFORMED A SAFETY INSPECTION ON THE TRUCK/TRAILER.  THE DRIVER OF THE TRUCK/TRAILERWAS CITED BY OFFICER FOR 1) NO MEDICAL CERTIFICATE ON DRIVER'S POSSESSION, 2) FLAT TIRE OR FABRIC EXPOSED 4 AND 5 AXLE RIGHT IN AND OUT, 3) COIL SPRING CRACKED AND OR BROKEN, 4) OVER LENGTH, 59 FEET.THE DRIVER OF TRUCK/TRAILER WAS ALSO PULLED "OUT OF SERVICE" UNTIL HE OBTAINS A PROPER MEDICAL WAIVER.  THE TRUCK/TRAILER WERE ALSO PULLED "OUT OF SERVICE".  OFFICER STATED THAT DRIVER OF THE TRUCK/TRAILER ADMITTED TO HAVING "SICKLE CELL".  OFFICER STATED THIS WAS PROBABLY WHY HE DID NOT HAVE A MEDICAL CARD, AS THIS WOULD HAVE KEPT HIM FROM LEGALLY DRIVING A TRUCK.  OFFICER ALSO INDICATED THAT SHE WOULD INSTRUCT DEPUTY TO CITE DRIVER OF TRUCK/TRAILER FOR "FAILURE TO CONTROL HIS VEHICLE".

673-d-02-13-05-VTR.Narrative: THE RD/MD TRAIN CREW WERE HEADING NORTH TO MIDDLEBURY.  AS THEY WERE COMING THROUGH PROCTOR AT MI. 60.7 A VERTICAL SPLIT HEAD BROKE OUT ON THE GUAGE SIDE OF A 105 POUND PIECE OF RAIL UNDERNEATH A LOADED CAR (SHPX 206089), CAUSING THE WHEELS OF THIS CAR TO DROP OFF THE RAIL AND GO INSIDE OF THE RAIL.THE TRAIN CREW NOTICED THEY HAD A CAR ON THE GROUND, AND APPLIED THE BRAKES. 189822-d-02-05-05-SOO.Narrative: OTHER TRACK INCIDENT - TRAIN 486-05 INBOUND FROM ST.PAUL WAS YARDED AT PORTAGE, CREW SET OUT 15 CARSAND RETURNED ENGINE TO CONSIST.  OUTBOUND CREW TOOK CHARGE OF TRAIN, WALKED THE CONSIST, CHECKED THE LAST UNIT FOR HAND BRAKE, BUT DID NOT SEE ANYTHING UNUSUAL, DEPARTED PORTAGE AND TOOK SIDING AT WYOCENA AT 17:55.  WHILE ENTERING SIDING, ENGINEER LOOKED BACK TO SEE WHEN THE REAR OF THE TRAIN CLEARED THE SIGNAL AND NOTICED SPARKS FROM THE WHEELS OF 2ND UNIT, NS 3324. AFTER STOPPING, ENGINEER INSPECTED FOR HAND BRAKE, BUT FOUND THE #2 R WHEEL IN THE GAUGE OF THE RAIL AND THE #2 L WHEEL FLANGE ON TOP OF THE RAIL. FOUND INTERMITANT TRACK DAMAGE BEGINNING APPROXIMATELY MP 226 (CAMP DOUGLAS ON THE TOMAH SUB) TO MP 169, WHERE DISCOVERED AT WYOCENA SIDING.

189872-d-02-10-05-DH.Narrative: EXTRA 2300 YARD ASSIGNMENT TOOK 20 CARS OFF THE RUNNING TRACK LEAVING 13 CARS. THE CONDUCTOR DID NOTENSURE THE 13 CARS ON THE RUNNING TRACK WERE SECURE. THE 2300 YARD THEN KICKED 2 CARS INTO TRACK SE6 WHERE THE BRAKEMAN WAS LOCATED TO HANDLE THE SWITCH AND SECURE THE CARS. NEXT THE CONDUCTOR DRIFTED 3 CARS INTO TRACK SE3, SET THE HAND BRAKE ON THE CARS AND THREW THE SWITCH BACK. AT THIS TIME HE LOOKED UP AND THOUGHT HE SAW THE CARS ON THE RUNNING TRACK MOVING. UPON FURTHER INVESTIGATION, HE FOUND THAT THE 13 CARS ON THE RUNNING TRACK ROLLED NORTH COLLIDING INTO THE SIDE OF THE CARS HE WAS HANDLING. FURTHER INVESTIGATION SHOWS THE CARS COLLIDED AND WERE MOVED IN BOTH DIRECTIONS, WHEN BEING PULLED NORTH INTO THE SWITCH, THE EAST RAIL ROLLED AND 3 CARS DERAILED.

2005017-d-02-02-05-DME.Narrative: DM&E CREW HAD TAKEN 32 CARS TO WOLSEY AND PUT AWAY IN YARD FOR BNSF TO PICK UP.  THEY PUT 28 ON THEPASSING TRACK AND 4 ON THE ELEVATOR TRACK.  A BNSF CREW LATER GOT THE CARS FROM THE ELEVATOR TRACK,DOUBLED TO THE PASSING TRACK, PULLED WEST, WENT INTO EMERGENCY AND SAW THAT CARS HAD DERAILED.  UPONINVESTIGATION, IT WAS DETERMINED THAT A DM&E CREW HAD RUN THROUGH THE SWITCH; HOWEVER, THE BNSF CREW DID NOT CHECK THE SWITCH PRIOR TO PULLING THE CARS PER RULE 8.2 IN SYSTEM SPECIAL INSTRUCTIONS.  IF THEY HAD, THEY WOULD HAVE FOUND THE RUN THROUGH SWITCH AND THE DERAILMENT WOULD NOT HAVE OCCURRED.1/29/06: A REVIEW OF THIS INCIDENT REVEALED THAT DM&E EMPLOYEES WERE PARTIALLY RESPONSIBLE FOR CAUSING THIS INCIDENT. FORMS 78 AND 81 WERE COMPLETED FOR THIS INCIDENT. EMPLOYEES WERE SENT FORMS 54 AND 78.

D24022605-d-02-26-05-FEC.Narrative: 10:00 PM REMOTE CONTROL JOB WAS DOUBLING UP TRACKS #4 TO #5 TO #3.  AS THEY WERE SHOVING TO A JOINTIN #3, THE AIR BLEW ON THE TRAIN.  AFTER CHECKING TO SEE WHAT WAS WRONG, THEY FOUND FEC 16092 WITH ALL WHEELS ON THE GROUND AND FEC 15810 WITH L3, L4, R3 & R4 DERAILED.  NO PERSONAL INJURIES WERE SUSTAINED.

X02022805-d-02-28-05-FEC.Narrative: TRAIN CREW AND WITNESSES REPORTED THE CROSSING GATES WERE FUNCTIONAL AND OPERATING PROPERLY WHEN THEDRIVER OF A FREIGHTLINER DUMP TRUCK DROVE AROUND THE LOWERED GATES.  TRAIN WAS PLACED INTO EMERGENCY BRAKING BUT WAS UNABLE TO STOP PRIOR TO IMPACT.  DRIVER OF DUMP TRUCK SUSTAINED FATAL INJURIES ANDTRAIN ENGINEER SUSTAINED A FRACTURED RIGHT ELBOW AND CONTUSIONS TO RIGHT ARM.

05001-d-02-07-05-GVSR.Narrative: THE SWITCHMAN STOPPED THE SHOVE AT THE RED BOARD NEAR 51ST STREET.  HE GOT OFF THE TRAIN AND ALIGNEDTHE CROSSOVER SWITCHES AND THE VALLEY YARD LEAD SWITCH AS WAS NECESSARY.  HE GOT BACK ON THE TRAINAND CONTINUED WITH THE SHOVE.  AFTER MOVING ABOUT 24 - 28 CAR LENGTHS THE ENGINEER FEELS SOME JERKING AND STOPS THE TRAIN.  THE SWITCHMAN WALKS ALONG THE TRAIN AND FINDS CARS HAVE DERAILED.  THE LOCATION OF THE DERAILED WHEELS ON THE LAST CAR DERAIL, BNSF 478091, WERE BETWEEN THE HEEL BLOCK AND THEFROG ON THE EAST YARD LEAD (TRACK 6192) SWITCH ON THE 6199/6192 CROSSOVER.  THIS TURNOUT IS 90# RAILWHILE ALL OF THE OTHER TRACK AND TURNOUTS IN THE AREA ARE 115# OR HEAVIER.  THE TIES WERE IN POOR CONDITION WITH A CONSIDERABLE AMOUNT OF PUMPING.  A LARGE NUMBER OF SPIKES HAD WORKED TOTALLY OUT OFTHE TIES.  GVSR UNDERSTANDS THAT BNSF HAS TAKEN THE POSITION THAT THE PRIMARY CAUSE OF THE DERAILMENT WAS H704 - SWITCH PREVIOUSLY RUN THROUGH.  BNSF TAKES THE POSITION THAT THE SWITCH THAT WAS PREVIOUSLY RUN THROUGH WAS THE VALLEY LEAD SWITCH.  THIS SWITCH POINT IS SOME 140 FEET AWAY FROM THE POINTOF DERAILMENT.  TWENTY TWO WHEELS OF 286,000 POUND CARS HAD MOVED THROUGH THE SWITCH ON THE GROUND.THE MOVEMENT WAS TRAILING THE POINTS ON THIS SWITCH AND THE CARS WERE MOVING STRAIGHT THROUGH THESWITCH.  EVEN IF THE SWITCH HAD BEEN PREVIOUSLY RUN THROUGH THE DIRECTION OF MOVEMENT WOULD NOT HAVECAUSED A DERAILMENT.  THERE WERE TWO GAGE RODS IN THE AREA OF THE POINT OF DERAILMENT THAT WERE LAY

THEY BLED THE TRAIN OF 81 CARS WHICH WAS ON THE WESTBOUND TRAIN.THE FIRST MOVE WAS TO KICK 4 CARS DOWN THE MAIN AND 1 CAR TO 2 TRACK.  THEY WENT TO THE MAIN AND TIED ONTO THE CARS AND SHOVED BACK 4 CARS.  PULLED THE PIN AND PULLED AHEAD ABOUT 4 CARS AND NOTICEDTHE CP 315034 WAS ON THE GROUND. CREW WAS DRUG/ALCOHOL TESTED WITH NEGATIVE RESULTS.  THERE WERE NOINJURIES.
